clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase I Clinical Trial of BAT4406F Injection in Patients With Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Clinical Trial of BAT4406F Injection on the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics in Patients With Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorders

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a phase I clinical study of the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of BAT4406F injection in patients with neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorders.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase 1, open-label, dose-escalation study in NMOSD patients in which subjects will receive BAT4406F injection via intravenous infusion. A 3 + 3 design will be utilized to define a maximum tolerated dose (MTD). The overall objective is to assess the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of BAT4406F injection in NMOSD patients.

intervention.description: Open-label dose escalation starting from 20mg. Route of administration: intravenous infusion.
